subject: Public Speaking
title: Alexander's Speech at the Hydaspes
description: A quick win: understand Alexander's Speech at the Hydaspes.

hook.text: Alexander's army refused to march further into India. He had one speech to change their minds.

buildup.text: His soldiers were exhausted after eight years of conquest, thousands of miles from home.

discovery.text: Alexander reminded them of every shared battle, every wound he bore alongside them. He made it personal.

twist.text: The army still refused. For the first time, the world's greatest conqueror was stopped â€” by his own men.

climax.text: Even a perfect speech has limits. Exhaustion and homesickness outweighed even Alexander's charisma.

punchline.text: The greatest general met his match: tired soldiers.

quiz.question: What happened after Alexander's speech at the Hydaspes?
options: His soldiers still refused to continue
